definitions: exchange of goods, services, or money between parties in business
single unit of work performed within a database management system
communication or interaction between people, especially in psychological analysis
examples: The transaction was completed after both parties signed the contract
Credit card transactions require verification before processing
Database transactions must be atomic to maintain data integrity
The system rolled back the transaction after detecting an error
Their emotional transactions revealed patterns of codependency
Every social transaction carries hidden meanings and expectations

definitions: state of being or existence beyond normal physical limits or material experience
philosophical idea of surpassing ordinary limitations of human knowledge or experience
examples: Meditation brought her moments of transcendence beyond everyday concerns
The mystic sought transcendence through years of spiritual practice
Kant's philosophy explores the limits of transcendence in human reason
Art offers glimpses of transcendence that logic cannot provide

definitions: written or printed version of spoken words from recordings or proceedings
official record of a student's academic performance and courses taken
RNA copy of a DNA sequence produced during gene transcription
examples: The court reporter prepared the transcript of the trial proceedings
She requested a transcript of the interview for her research
His college transcript showed excellent grades in all subjects
Universities require official transcripts for admission applications
The RNA transcript carries genetic information from nucleus to ribosome
Scientists analyzed transcript levels to measure gene expression

definitions: process of converting spoken words or audio into written or typed form
arrangement of a musical composition for different instruments or voices
biological process where DNA information is copied into RNA molecules
examples: The transcription of the meeting took several hours to complete
Medical transcription requires attention to technical terminology
Liszt's transcription of Beethoven's symphonies for piano became famous
The guitar transcription captured the essence of the orchestral piece
Transcription factors regulate when genes are turned on or off
RNA polymerase catalyzes the transcription of DNA into RNA

definitions: device that converts one form of energy or signal into another form
medical device that emits and receives ultrasound waves for imaging
electronic component that converts physical quantities into electrical signals
examples: The microphone transducer converts sound waves into electrical signals
Piezoelectric transducers are used in many sensing applications
The ultrasound transducer revealed detailed images of the fetus
Different transducer frequencies provide varying tissue penetration depths
Pressure transducers monitor hydraulic system performance continuously
The temperature transducer triggered an alarm when limits exceeded

definitions: process of converting one form of signal or energy into another form
transfer of genetic material between bacteria via viral vectors called bacteriophages
conversion of sensory stimuli into neural signals in the nervous system
examples: Signal transduction pathways control cellular responses to external stimuli
Mechanical transduction converts physical force into electrical signals
Bacterial transduction enables horizontal gene transfer between species
Phage-mediated transduction spreads antibiotic resistance genes rapidly
Sensory transduction begins when photons strike retinal cells
Pain transduction involves specialized nerve endings called nociceptors

definitions: part of a church that crosses the main body at right angles, forming a cross shape
examples: The cathedral's transept contained beautiful stained glass windows
Pilgrims gathered in the north transept for the special service

definitions: act of moving something or someone from one place to another
legal conveyance of property, rights, or ownership from one party to another
image or design that can be moved from one surface to another
movement of a player from one sports team to another team
examples: The transfer of patients between hospitals requires careful coordination
Data transfer speeds depend on network bandwidth availability
The property transfer was completed after all documents were signed
Stock transfers must be registered with the company secretary
She applied the transfer decal to the ceramic before firing
Iron-on transfers let you customize plain t-shirts easily
The soccer player's transfer fee broke all previous records
Transfer deadline day always generates excitement among fans

definitions: unconscious redirection of feelings from one person to another in psychotherapy
act or process of transferring something from one place or person to another
examples: The therapist recognized transference when the patient expressed anger meant for his father
Positive transference can facilitate therapeutic progress when properly managed
Heat transference through the metal was rapid and efficient
The transference of skills between jobs enhanced her career

definitions: supernatural transformation of Jesus Christ's appearance as described in the Gospels
complete change of form or appearance into something more beautiful or spiritual
examples: The Transfiguration of Christ is celebrated as a major feast day
Raphael's painting depicts the Transfiguration on Mount Tabor
The artist's transfiguration of scrap metal into sculptures amazed viewers
Her face showed a transfiguration when she heard the good news

definitions: thorough or dramatic change in form, appearance, nature, or character
mathematical operation that changes the position, size, or shape of a geometric figure
biological process of complete physical change during an organism's development
examples: Digital transformation revolutionized how businesses operate globally
Her transformation from shy student to confident leader inspired others
The geometric transformation preserved the triangle's angles but changed its size
Matrix transformations are fundamental to computer graphics programming
The caterpillar's transformation into a butterfly takes several weeks
Bacterial transformation involves uptake of foreign DNA molecules

definitions: electrical device that transfers energy between circuits through electromagnetic induction
shape-shifting robot character from the popular toy and media franchise
person or thing that causes significant change or transformation
examples: The power transformer stepped down voltage from transmission to distribution levels
A faulty transformer caused the neighborhood power outage
My son collects vintage Transformers from the original toy line
The new Transformers movie features stunning visual effects
She became a transformer of educational practices in her district
Social media emerged as a transformer of political discourse

definitions: medical procedure of transferring blood or blood products into a person's circulation
introduction of any fluid into the bloodstream for medical treatment
examples: The accident victim required an emergency blood transfusion
Transfusion reactions can occur if blood types are incompatible
The patient received a plasma transfusion to replace clotting factors
Saline transfusion helped restore the patient's fluid balance

definitions: act of violating a law, command, moral code, or accepted standard
act of going beyond or overstepping a limit or boundary
examples: His transgression of company policy resulted in immediate termination
Religious texts warn against moral transgressions and their consequences
The river's transgression flooded the surrounding farmland
Geological transgressions occur when sea levels rise over land

definitions: quality or state of being temporary, brief, or passing quickly through time
examples: The transience of human life makes each moment precious
Cherry blossoms symbolize the transience of beauty in Japanese culture

definitions: person who stays or works in a place for only a short time
something that exists briefly or passes quickly through a system
brief surge or fluctuation in voltage or current in an electrical circuit
examples: The shelter provides meals for transients passing through town
Transient workers follow seasonal agricultural harvests
Scientists observed transient phenomena in the particle accelerator
The transient nature of fame became clear to the young star
Power transients can damage sensitive electronic equipment
Surge protectors guard against dangerous electrical transients

definitions: semiconductor device used to amplify or switch electronic signals and power
small portable radio that uses transistors instead of vacuum tubes
examples: The transistor revolutionized electronics by replacing bulky vacuum tubes
Modern microprocessors contain billions of transistors on a single chip
His grandfather still listens to baseball games on an old transistor
Transistor radios made music portable for the first time

definitions: act of passing through or across a place during a journey
system of buses, trains, or other forms of public transportation
passage of a celestial body across the disk of a larger body
examples: Goods in transit are covered by special insurance policies
The package was lost in transit between warehouses
The city's transit system includes buses, subways, and light rail
Many commuters depend on public transit to reach work
The transit of Venus across the Sun occurs in predictable patterns
Astronomers gathered to observe the rare planetary transit

definitions: process or period of changing from one state or condition to another
process of changing one's gender presentation to align with gender identity
visual effect in video or presentation that connects two scenes or slides
examples: The transition from high school to college challenges many students
Economic transition from industrial to service economy took decades
Her transition included hormone therapy and social changes
Support during transition helps transgender individuals thrive
The editor added a fade transition between the two scenes
PowerPoint offers various slide transition effects

definitions: process of converting text or speech from one language into another language
movement of a body from one point to another without rotation
transformation that moves every point of a figure the same distance and direction
examples: The translation of the novel from French took six months
Machine translation has improved dramatically with artificial intelligence
The translation of the spacecraft required precise calculations
Molecular translation occurs when ribosomes move along mRNA
The geometric translation shifted the triangle five units right
Vector translation preserves the shape and size of objects

definitions: person who converts written or spoken material from one language to another
device or program that converts information from one form to another
examples: The UN translator interpreted speeches in real-time for delegates
Literary translators must capture both meaning and style
The protocol translator enables communication between incompatible systems
This optical translator converts text to speech for visually impaired users

definitions: passage of the soul into another body after death in certain religious beliefs
movement of a large group of people from one region or country to another
examples: Hindu philosophy describes transmigration through cycles of rebirth
The concept of transmigration appears in many Eastern religions
The transmigration of tribes shaped the demographic landscape
Historical transmigration programs relocated millions of people

definitions: process of transmitting or sending something from one place or person to another
mechanical system that transmits power from engine to wheels in vehicles
passing of a disease or infection from one person or organism to another
examples: Radio transmission quality depends on atmospheric conditions
Data transmission speeds have increased exponentially over decades
The car's automatic transmission shifted smoothly through all gears
Manual transmission vehicles are becoming less common
Mosquitoes are vectors for disease transmission in tropical regions
Airborne transmission of viruses poses significant health risks

definitions: electronic device that produces and broadcasts electromagnetic waves carrying messages or signals
chemical substance that transmits nerve impulses across a synapse
person or thing that transmits something to others
examples: The radio transmitter broadcasts signals across the entire region
Faulty transmitters caused communication blackouts during the storm
Neurotransmitters like dopamine regulate mood and behavior
The transmitter molecules bind to specific receptor sites
She became an effective transmitter of cultural traditions
Children are often transmitters of infectious diseases in schools

definitions: act or process of sending signals, messages, or energy through space or a medium
act of passing something from one person, place, or thing to another
examples: The satellite is transmitting data back to Earth continuously
Transmitting on this frequency requires a special license
The teacher focused on transmitting knowledge effectively to students
Transmitting genetic traits follows predictable patterns

definitions: medieval alchemical process of attempting to change base metals into gold
change of one chemical element into another through nuclear reaction
complete change in form, nature, or substance of something
examples: Alchemists believed in transmutation of lead into gold
The transmutation circle was a key symbol in medieval alchemy
Nuclear transmutation occurs naturally in radioactive decay
Scientists achieved artificial transmutation in particle accelerators
The artist's transmutation of everyday objects into art amazed critics
Time brought about a transmutation of their friendship into love

definitions: horizontal crossbar or beam above a door or window, often containing a window
flat surface forming the stern of a square-ended boat
examples: Light streamed through the transom window above the front door
Victorian homes often feature decorative transom windows
The boat's name was painted across the transom in bold letters
Water splashed over the transom during rough seas

definitions: quality of being able to see through a material or substance clearly
practice of being open, honest, and straightforward in business or governance
transparent sheet used for overhead projection in presentations
examples: The glass had perfect transparency without any distortion
Water transparency affects photosynthesis in aquatic plants
Government transparency helps build public trust in institutions
Financial transparency is required for all public companies
The teacher wrote on transparencies for the overhead projector
Color transparencies showed the artwork in vivid detail

definitions: surgical operation moving an organ or tissue from one body to another
plant or tree that has been moved from one location to another
organ or tissue that has been surgically transferred to a recipient
examples: The kidney transplant saved her life after years of dialysis
Transplant recipients must take immunosuppressive medications
These tomato transplants need protection from late spring frosts
The transplants adapted well to their new garden location
The surgeon examined the transplant for signs of rejection
Heart transplants have become increasingly successful procedures

definitions: surgical procedure of transferring organs or tissues from donor to recipient
act of moving something, especially plants or people, to a new location
examples: Bone marrow transplantation treats certain blood cancers effectively
The transplantation team coordinated the complex multi-organ procedure
The transplantation of European customs influenced colonial societies
Coral transplantation helps restore damaged reef ecosystems

definitions: process of moving plants from one growing location to another location
act of surgically transferring organs or tissues between bodies
examples: Transplanting seedlings requires careful handling of delicate roots
Spring is the ideal time for transplanting most perennials
The hospital specializes in transplanting kidneys and livers
Transplanting corneas can restore sight to blind patients

definitions: electronic device that receives a signal and automatically transmits a different signal in response
examples: Aircraft transponders help air traffic control identify planes on radar
The toll road transponder automatically deducts payment from your account

definitions: system or means of conveying people or goods from place to place
overwhelming strong emotion that carries someone beyond normal self-control
large vehicle, ship, or aircraft used to carry troops or supplies
examples: Public transport reduces traffic congestion in urban areas
The company arranges transport for all employees
She was in transports of joy when she heard the news
His anger reached such transports that friends grew concerned
The military transport carried troops to the conflict zone
Transport planes delivered humanitarian aid to the region

definitions: action or process of transporting people or goods from one place to another
historical punishment of sending convicted criminals to a penal colony
examples: Transportation infrastructure supports economic development nationwide
The transportation of hazardous materials requires special permits
Transportation to Australia was common punishment in British courts
Criminals faced transportation rather than execution for many crimes

definitions: vehicle or device designed to carry people or things from place to place
protein that moves molecules across cell membranes
person or company that transports goods or people professionally
examples: The car transporter delivered vehicles to dealerships nationwide
Military transporters can carry tanks and heavy equipment
Glucose transporters facilitate sugar uptake into cells
Membrane transporters regulate cellular ion concentrations
The transporter guaranteed delivery within forty-eight hours
Licensed transporters must follow strict safety regulations

definitions: change of a piece of music into a different key while maintaining relationships
mathematical operation exchanging rows and columns of a matrix
examples: The pianist had to transpose the song down two keys
Singers often transpose songs to suit their vocal range
To transpose a matrix, switch its rows with its columns
The transpose operation is fundamental in linear algebra

definitions: act of changing the order or position of things, especially reversing two elements
process of rewriting music in a different key
genetic mutation where a chromosome segment moves to a new location
examples: The transposition of letters created an embarrassing typo
A simple transposition of words changed the sentence meaning entirely
The transposition made the piece playable on different instruments
Transposition charts help musicians change keys quickly
Chromosomal transposition can cause genetic disorders
Transposition of genetic elements drives evolutionary change

definitions: person whose gender identity differs from their assigned sex at birth, especially one who has undergone medical treatment
examples: The clinic provides comprehensive care for transsexual patients
Many transsexual individuals face discrimination in healthcare settings

definitions: transfer of goods from one ship or form of transport to another during shipping
examples: The port specializes in transshipment of containerized cargo
Transshipment hubs reduce overall shipping costs significantly

definitions: person who derives emotional satisfaction from dressing in clothes associated with the opposite sex
examples: The transvestite performer entertained audiences with elaborate costumes
Historical accounts describe transvestites in many cultures

definitions: device or enclosure designed to catch and retain animals or persons
curved section of pipe that holds water to prevent sewer gases from entering
geological structure that accumulates and holds petroleum or natural gas
style of hip-hop music characterized by heavy bass and hi-hat patterns
examples: The mouse trap caught three mice in one night
Poachers set illegal traps throughout the protected forest
The plumber replaced the corroded trap under the sink
Every drain needs a trap to block sewer odors
Geologists identified a promising trap formation for oil exploration
Salt dome traps often contain significant petroleum deposits
Trap music originated in the Southern United States
The trap beat dominated the hip-hop charts

definitions: short horizontal bar suspended by two ropes used for acrobatic performances
examples: The circus performer executed a triple flip on the flying trapeze
Learning trapeze requires strength, timing, and courage

definitions: quadrilateral with at least one pair of parallel sides
small bone in the wrist between the scaphoid and second metacarpal
examples: The students calculated the area of the trapezoid using the formula
A trapezoid has exactly one pair of parallel sides in Euclidean geometry
The trapezoid bone fracture required surgical repair
X-rays revealed damage to the trapezoid in her wrist

definitions: person who traps animals, especially for their fur
person who sets traps to catch something or someone
examples: The fur trapper spent winters in the remote wilderness
Historical trappers played a crucial role in exploring North America
The pest trapper removed raccoons from the attic
Professional trappers help control invasive species populations

definitions: practice or process of catching animals or things in traps
ornamental accessories or outward signs of success, wealth, or position
examples: Trapping regulations protect endangered species from harm
His grandfather taught him traditional trapping techniques
The trappings of wealth couldn't hide his unhappiness
She rejected the trappings of corporate success

definitions: discarded matter or refuse, especially items thrown away as worthless
cultural products, ideas, or talk regarded as being of very poor quality
aggressive criticism or verbal attacks intended to damage reputation
examples: The maintenance crew empties trash bins twice daily
Recycling programs divert trash from landfills
Critics dismissed the movie as formulaic trash
Don't waste time reading that tabloid trash
The candidate tried to trash his opponent's record
Online trolls love to trash people anonymously

definitions: serious physical injury caused by sudden impact, violence, or accident
deeply distressing experience causing lasting psychological and emotional damage
examples: The emergency room treats severe trauma cases twenty-four seven
Blunt force trauma to the head requires immediate medical attention
Childhood trauma can affect mental health throughout adulthood
Therapy helps process trauma and develop coping strategies

definitions: painful or laborious effort, especially physical or mental hardship
pain and suffering of childbirth or labor pains
examples: The artist's travails eventually led to creative breakthrough
Their travails during the war shaped their entire generation
The midwife supported her through hours of travail
Medieval texts often describe the travails of childbirth

definitions: act of going from one place to another, typically over a distance
range, rate, or mode of movement of a mechanical part
examples: International travel requires valid passport documentation
Travel broadens the mind and enriches life experiences
The suspension travel determines how much the wheel can move
Adjust the clutch pedal travel for optimal performance

definitions: person who is traveling or who travels frequently to different places
member of a traditionally nomadic ethnic group, especially Irish Travellers
examples: Experienced travelers always carry backup identification documents
The weary traveler finally reached her destination
The Traveler community maintains strong cultural traditions
Travelers often face discrimination in housing and employment
